Also as an alternative you can use the System Backup V2 and also you can do periodical snapshots from the virtualization environment.

Hi Ram,

Sure, no problem, I thought the previous email which contains actually answers for this did not reached to you. But I will answer each of your questions below:

1) What are the differences between System Backup & System Backup v2 ?

The System Backup represents the first System backup where you could choose to backup only the configuration or the configuration + the logs database, but the technology behind this feature is not deprecated and as per this the Endpoint Protector team released the System Backup V2, which uses new technology, making the backups smaller and faster. As a difference the System Backup V2 does not contains logs inside due to the fact that the logs are being Back up by the Audit Backup feature.

2) Will System Backup v2 store all server configurations, as well as users / agents details?

Yes the System Backup V2 contains everything in terms of configuration, settings, rights, policies, entities, except the logs and shadows.


3) If creating a backup using System Backup v2 is working fine, is it still necessary or important  to take the System Backup as well? 

As mentioned above - soon the System Backup V1 will be removed and we will have only the System backup V2 in EPP so you can continue using only the V2 feature having all benefits included.


Best regards,

Creating regular snapshots (or checkpoints as Microsoft currently calls this feature) is a best practice heavily used across the industry when working with virtual machines and virtualization environments, but also across Endpoint Protector customers. We encourage all our customers to take advantage of this well-established practice and back up the whole Endpoint Protector virtual machine (state, logs/ events, settings and configured policies).
Furthermore, our team is announcing the depreciation of the System Backup feature since September 2023 (see release notes starting EPP version 5.9.0.0) to prepare all customers to familiarize themselves with the alternatives.

Also as an alternative you can use the System Backup V2 and also you can do periodical snapshots from the virtualization environment.
 
We hope that above insights will help your team decide on the optimal backup option for your team's needs.

Also as an alternative you can use the System Backup V2 and also you can do periodical snapshots from the virtualization environment.
